page.title: 11A FARMER'S SON cont.
page.content:
7-00pm Friends of ours visited. They keep bullocks. 7-30pm I played{tig }with James. 7-40pm Nan and Grand-dad called in. We had drinks. Some was wine and some was lemonade. 9-05pm I tried to squat some flies with the newspaper. We get quite a lot this time of year. 9-35pm A milk-tooth came out. 9-40pm Our friends left and I went to bed after a busy Sunday.
Robert is the only son of a local farmer.Bokiddick is a dairy farm of 80 friesians. It has been in the hands of Robert's family for 78 years having been purchased from a Mr. Thomas in 1907 by Great-Grandfather Lobb.Robert sees his future working alonside his father when he leaves school and finally to take over when Dad retires.
